node.title: Shaun visited a plant nursery last week. Now he's quarantined in an Adelaide medi-hotel
node.alt: A man with short curly hair and glasses
node.description: Shaun Ferguson shares his experience of what happened after he visited a pet and plant store that later became a high-risk COVID-19 exposure site.Â
node.content:
["When Shaun Ferguson was browsing the plants at a local nursery last Tuesday afternoon, he\u00a0never thought it would land him in two weeks quarantine in a medi-hotel.\u00a0", "That\u00a0night he received the\u00a0text message that no one wants to receive.\u00a0", "\"At about 11.30 that night I got a text message from SA Health saying that I'd been to a potential exposure site for the Omicron strain,\" Mr Ferguson said.\u00a0", "As per the instructions, Mr Ferguson immediately got tested but what followed from then was a whirlwind of uncertainty.\u00a0", "An SA Health employee called him the next day and told him he\u00a0could isolate at home with his husband and, that if he tested negative, he could be released out of isolation after seven days as he had been\u00a0fully vaccinated.\u00a0", "\"After five minutes [the employee] came back and said, 'I'm really sorry. I've given you some false information, because it's the Omicron variant they are not necessarily happy for you to be isolating at home with your husband and they are going to consider putting you in a medi-hotel',\" Mr Ferguson said.\u00a0", "He was then told to wait for another phone call from SA Health.\u00a0", "A few hours later, Mr Ferguson said he received an email from SA Health telling him to isolate for seven days.\u00a0", "\"I replied to the email asking if someone could call me, as the information was quite conflicting as to what I had been told,\" he said.\u00a0", "Within the next hour he received a phone call from the SA Health helpline.\u00a0", "\"They were a bit confused as well but, basically, said I needed to ignore the email that had come through that it was potentially false information,\" Mr Ferguson said.\u00a0", "", "
Mr Ferguson was taken to the Pullman medi-hotel in Hindmarsh Square.\u00a0(ABC News: Haidarr Jones)
", "Then, again, at about 11.30pm, he received a text message from SA Health telling him to prepare to be transported to a medi-hotel in\u00a0the\u00a0morning.", "\"Eight o'clock in the morning the bus arrived with the police escort picking me up to take me to hotel quarantine,\" Mr Ferguson said.\u00a0\u00a0", "There were three other people on the bus with him, including a woman who had also visited the pet and plant shop in Glengowrie.", "\"She said, 'I never go anywhere, I'm fully vaccinated \u2026\u00a0I just decided I'd go there and get this cat brush and now look what happens.\u00a0I'm in quarantine,'\" Mr Ferguson said.\u00a0", "He said the other people on the bus were confused about what was happening as well.\u00a0", "\"They also got last-minute directions as to what was going to be happening with them as well and were also taken away from their families,\" he said.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"It was very confusing, very stressful and very uncertain as what to do. It was hard.\"\u00a0", "", "
Mr Ferguson says the lack of fresh air in the room concerns him.\u00a0(Supplied: Shaun Ferguson)
", "
Medi-hotel goes into 'red zone' mode
", "When the bus\u00a0arrived at the Pullman Hotel, Mr Ferguson said they had to wait around 10 minutes while the hotel went into its\u00a0'red zone' mode.\u00a0", "\"They lock the whole hotel down, and surrounding areas, so there [were]\u00a0gates that we had to enter.\u00a0Police were all around the area,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"Once they lock into a red zone, it means no one can travel between certain floors while they let people in.\"\u00a0", "He said he was given a replacement face mask before being instructed to speak to a police officer stationed at the hotel who asked him a few questions and took his driver's licence.\u00a0", "He was then escorted to his room.\u00a0", "\"There's no windows that can be opened, no balcony, no fresh air, so you are stuck with air-con the whole time and no real sunlight.\u00a0", "\"Apart from that, the room is quite nice.\"\u00a0", "", "
Mr Ferguson says the hotel staff have been lovely.\u00a0(Supplied: Shaun Ferguson)
", "
Fully vaccinated and frustrated
", "Mr Ferguson said he had always followed the rules and wanted to protect those who were\u00a0vulnerable in the community from catching COVID-19, but it was hard not to feel frustrated.\u00a0", "\"You do go through mixed emotions \u2026\u00a0considering you're vaccinated and the situation you're put in at this time of year, it's going to be pretty difficult for a lot of people being pulled away from their families at a time when you should be out celebrating,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"It's quite frustrating that the government has opened the borders to allow people to celebrate with their families, which I did understand to some extent, but it now means there are quite a few people who are going to be affected.\u00a0", "Mr Ferguson, who is a hairdresser and owns his own salon, said his quarantine had already had a significant financial impact on his business and potential loss of clients.\u00a0", "He said he had been unable to isolate at home with his husband because they only have one bathroom.\u00a0", "", "
